alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Upper Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 6:12PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...SNOW SQUALL... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 612 PM MDT, a snow squall was along a line extending from 15 miles north of Craig to near Silt and moving east at 30 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Glenwood Springs, Craig, Rifle, New Castle, Silt, Meeker, Hayden, Lay, Tow Creek, Loyd, Shoshone, Buford, Great Divide, Axial, Hamilton and Fortification. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 85 and 133. U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 72 and 119. Colorado 13 between mile markers 1 and 11, and between mile markers 44 and 119. Colorado 82 between mile markers 1 and 6. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Upper Yampa River Basin
